taxonomicnotes: The populations aggregated under this name represent an unresolved species complex and might be split in several different species in future.
rationale: A widespread species that occurs in many more then 10 independent populations and is not believed to decline fast enough to qualify for a NT or a threatened category. It is therefore assessed as LC.
evaluator: Ekmekçi, F., Özuluğ, M. & Smith, K.
